Exaggerate: The claim suggests that hospitals get paid more if patients are listed as COVID-19 on ventilators, implying a significant increase in payment.
Understate: The claim does not understate any information.
Lack enough support: The claim is supported by the statement of Sen. Scott Jensen, a physician, but no further evidence or data is provided to support the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that hospitals and administrators may pressure physicians to cite all diagnoses, including "probable" COVID-19, on discharge papers or death certificates to receive higher Medicare allocations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not mention any alternative explanations or possibilities.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that hospitals receive three times as much money if patients listed as COVID-19 need a ventilator, as stated by Sen. Scott Jensen.
Falters at times: The claim does not falter at any specific point.
